quiz_metadata.title: Java Collections: Sets and Maps
quiz_metadata.description: This quiz covers the main concepts and topics related to Sets and Maps in Java, including HashSet, TreeSet, HashMap, and TreeMap.

questions.question_text: What is the main difference between a Set and a List in Java?

options.text: A Set allows duplicates, while a List does not
A Set does not allow duplicates, while a List does
A Set is ordered, while a List is not
A Set is not ordered, while a List is

questions.explanation: A Set in Java is a collection that does not allow duplicate elements, whereas a List can have duplicate elements.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of the 'add' method in a Set?

options.text: To remove an element from the Set
To add an element to the Set if it does not already exist
To clear all elements from the Set
To check if an element exists in the Set

questions.explanation: The 'add' method in a Set is used to add an element to the Set if it does not already exist. If the element already exists, the method returns false.

questions.question_text: What is the difference between a HashSet and a TreeSet?

options.text: A HashSet is ordered, while a TreeSet is not
A HashSet is not ordered, while a TreeSet is ordered
A HashSet allows duplicates, while a TreeSet does not
A HashSet is faster than a TreeSet

questions.explanation: A HashSet is not ordered, meaning that the elements are not stored in any particular order. A TreeSet, on the other hand, is ordered, meaning that the elements are stored in a specific order, either naturally or based on a Comparator.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of the 'contains' method in a Set?

options.text: To add an element to the Set
To remove an element from the Set
To check if an element exists in the Set
To clear all elements from the Set

questions.explanation: The 'contains' method in a Set is used to check if an element exists in the Set.

questions.question_text: What is a Map in Java?

options.text: A collection of unique elements
A collection of key-value pairs
A collection of ordered elements
A collection of unordered elements

questions.explanation: A Map in Java is a collection of key-value pairs, where each key is unique and maps to a specific value.

questions.question_text: What is the difference between a HashMap and a TreeMap?

options.text: A HashMap is ordered, while a TreeMap is not
A HashMap is not ordered, while a TreeMap is ordered
A HashMap allows duplicates, while a TreeMap does not
A HashMap is faster than a TreeMap

questions.explanation: A HashMap is not ordered, meaning that the key-value pairs are not stored in any particular order. A TreeMap, on the other hand, is ordered, meaning that the key-value pairs are stored in a specific order, either naturally or based on a Comparator.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of the 'put' method in a Map?

options.text: To remove a key-value pair from the Map
To add a key-value pair to the Map
To clear all key-value pairs from the Map
To check if a key exists in the Map

questions.explanation: The 'put' method in a Map is used to add a key-value pair to the Map. If the key already exists, the value is updated.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of the 'get' method in a Map?

options.text: To add a key-value pair to the Map
To remove a key-value pair from the Map
To clear all key-value pairs from the Map
To retrieve the value associated with a given key

questions.explanation: The 'get' method in a Map is used to retrieve the value associated with a given key.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of the 'containsKey' method in a Map?

options.text: To add a key-value pair to the Map
To remove a key-value pair from the Map
To clear all key-value pairs from the Map
To check if a key exists in the Map

questions.explanation: The 'containsKey' method in a Map is used to check if a key exists in the Map.

questions.question_text: How do you iterate over the keys in a Map?

options.text: Using a for-each loop on the Map object
Using a for-each loop on the Map's keySet
Using a for loop on the Map's entrySet
Using a while loop on the Map's values

questions.explanation: You can iterate over the keys in a Map using a for-each loop on the Map's keySet.
